==Events==
* [[226]] &ndash; [[Cao Pi]] dies after an illness; his son [[Cao Rui]] succeeds him as emperor of the [[Kingdom of Wei]].
*[[1149]] &ndash; [[Raymond of Poitiers]] is defeated and killed at the [[Battle of Inab]] by [[Nur ad-Din Zangi]].
*[[1194]] &ndash; [[Sverre of Norway|Sverre]] is crowned [[King of Norway]].
*[[1444]] &ndash; [[Skanderbeg]] defeats an Ottoman invasion force at [[Battle of Torvioll|Torvioll]].
*[[1534]] &ndash; [[Jacques Cartier]] is the first [[Ethnic groups in Europe|European]] to reach [[Prince Edward Island]].
*[[1613]] &ndash; The [[Globe Theatre#Shakespeare's Globe Theatres|Globe Theatre]] in [[London]], [[England]] burns to the ground.
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Charles I of England]] defeats a [[Roundhead|Parliamentarian]] detachment at the [[Battle of Cropredy Bridge]], the last battle won by an [[England|English]] King on English soil.
*[[1659]] &ndash; At the [[Battle of Konotop]] the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] armies of [[Ivan Vyhovsky]] defeat the [[Russia]]ns led by [[Aleksey Trubetskoy|Prince Trubetskoy]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; First [[privateer]] battle of the [[American Revolutionary War]] fought at [[Battle of Turtle Gut Inlet|Turtle Gut Inlet]] near [[Cape May, New Jersey]]
*  1776   &ndash; Father Francisco Palou founds [[Mission San Francisco de Asis]] in what is now [[San Francisco, California]].
*[[1786]] &ndash; [[Alexander Macdonell (bishop)|Alexander Macdonell]] and over five hundred [[Roman Catholic]] highlanders leave [[Scotland]] to settle in [[Glengarry County]], [[Ontario]].
*[[1807]] &ndash; [[Russo-Turkish War (1806–1812)|Russo-Turkish War]]: Admiral [[Dmitry Senyavin]] destroys the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] fleet in the [[Battle of Athos]].
*[[1850]] &ndash; [[Autocephaly]] officially granted by the [[Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople]] to the [[Church of Greece]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; Ninety-nine people are killed in [[Canada]]'s worst [[St-Hilaire train disaster|railway disaster]] near [[Mont-Saint-Hilaire, Quebec|St-Hilaire]], [[Quebec]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; Greek politician [[Charilaos Trikoupis]] publishes a manifesto in the [[Athens]] daily ''Kairoi'' entitled "Who's to Blame?" in which he lays out his complaints against [[George I of Greece|King George]]. He is elected [[Prime Minister of Greece]] the next year.
*[[1880]] &ndash; [[France]] annexes [[Tahiti]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; In Sudan, [[Muhammad Ahmad]] declares himself to be the [[Mahdi]], the messianic redeemer of Islam.
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[George Edward Gouraud]] records [[George Frideric Handel|Handel]]'s ''[[Israel in Egypt]]'' onto a [[phonograph cylinder]], thought for many years to be the oldest known recording of music.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Hyde Park Township, Cook County, Illinois|Hyde Park]] and several other [[Illinois]] townships vote to be annexed by [[Chicago]], forming the largest [[United States]] city in area and second largest in population.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Doukhobors]] burn their weapons as a protest against conscription by the [[Russian Empire|Tsarist Russian government]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Jina Guseva]] attempts to assassinate [[Grigori Rasputin]] at his home town in [[Siberia]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; The [[Irish Nationalism|Irish Nationalist]] and [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|British]] [[diplomat]] Sir [[Roger Casement]] is sentenced to death for his part in the [[Easter Rising]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[France]] grants 1&nbsp;km² at [[Vimy Ridge]] "freely, and for all time, to the [[Government of Canada]], the free use of the land exempt from all taxes".
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Arthur Meighen]] returns to office as [[Prime Minister of Canada]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; The ''[[Bird of Paradise (aircraft)|Bird of Paradise]]'', a [[U.S. Army Air Corps]] Fokker tri-motor, completes the first transpacific flight, from the mainland United States to [[Hawaii]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; First test of [[Wallace Turnbull]]'s [[controllable pitch propeller]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; The [[Outerbridge Crossing]] and [[Goethals Bridge]] in [[Staten Island, New York]] are both opened.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Carpathian Ruthenia]] is annexed by the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1956]] is signed, officially creating the [[United States]] [[Interstate Highway System]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The [[U.S. Supreme Court]] rules in the case ''[[Furman v. Georgia]]'' that arbitrary and inconsistent imposition of the death penalty violates the [[Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Eighth]] and [[Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Fourteenth]] Amendments, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Isabel Perón]] is sworn in as the first female [[President of Argentina|President]] of [[Argentina]]. Her husband, President [[Juan Peron]], had delegated responsibility due to weak health and died two days later.
*  1974   &ndash; [[Mikhail Baryshnikov]] defects from the [[Soviet Union]] to [[Canada]] while on tour with the [[Kirov Ballet]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Steve Wozniak]] tested his first prototype of [[Apple I]] computer.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[Seychelles]] become independent from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-71]] Mission (''[[Space Shuttle Atlantis|Atlantis]]'') docks with the [[Mir|Russian space station ''Mir'']] for the first time.
*  1995   &ndash; The [[Sampoong Department Store collapse]]s in the [[Seocho-gu]] district of [[Seoul]], [[South Korea]], killing 501 and injuring 937.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[2nd Battle of the Western Sea|Naval clashes]] between [[South Korea]] and [[North Korea]] lead to the death of six South Korean sailors and sinking of a North Korean vessel.
*[[2006]] &ndash; ''[[Hamdan v. Rumsfeld]]'': The [[U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that President [[George W. Bush]]'s plan to try [[Guantanamo Bay detention camp|Guantanamo Bay detainees]] in military tribunals violates U.S. and [[international law]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Apple Inc.]] releases its first mobile phone, the [[iPhone]]. 
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[derecho]] [[June 2012 North American derecho|strikes]] the eastern [[United States]], leaving at least 22 people dead and millions without power.
